title: Riot, you should take a thematic look at Fiora
body:
I'll sum up the reason why with a few quick GIFs:

This is how Fiora should play and feel:

[Teh DPS](http://i.minus.com/ibnlybXWF2UTZy.gif)
[Riposte outplays](http://33.media.tumblr.com/tumblr_mbw6d1He6C1r3ifxzo1_500.gif)

This is how it should feel to play against Fiora:

[As melee](http://fc06.deviantart.net/fs70/f/2013/018/b/0/sword_art_online_gif___infinity_combo_by_vitoramorosouzu-d5rwhrr.gif)
[As ranged](http://www.videogamefilms.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/SAO-II-5-GIF.gif)

This is how Fiora actually plays:

[When you try to fight people who are actually strong at dueling](http://fc06.deviantart.net/fs71/f/2013/003/0/d/sao___kirito_vs_eugene_by_emicopper777-d5qbxe4.gif)
[When you teamfight instead of 1v1ing](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E_1dDIZ8c7s)

This is what it feels like when the other team picks Fiora:

[when you see her picked](http://assets.sbnation.com/assets/2461449/BULLSFA1.jpg)

TL;DR if Fiora's gonna be the "Grand Duelist", her primary strength should be dueling and not ulting teamfights

EDIT: Guys I just had Sword Art Online on the brain. Fiora doesn't actually have to play like an SAO character (although it would still be totally badass if she did); she should just have her focused pushed to being a mechanically deep 1v1 duelist as opposed to a melee carry with a teamfight-oriented ult.

replies.body:
I personally agree with this sentiment as right now Fiora feels... odd to play? Especially considering her identity. 

This could be a lot of the issue. 

Her play style may not necessarily fit her theme of being this awesome, highly skilled Duelist. But is that what's right for Fiora in the long run? Is there more than she could be besides simply a French girl that's really good at fencing. What makes her more unique, what makes her stand out past this?

There are so many opportunities to mold her into something stronger, better. Curious what you guys think she could become.

What is driving her to be a master of the blade? Perhaps fencing was her escape. Perhaps her pain caused her to turn into fencing, eventually making her the grand duelist she is today. 

Fencing is certainly not a cheap hobby, perhaps she was well off. Perhaps her parents died young, leaving her and her little sister on the street. Fencing was her perhaps hope for survival, so she fenced day in and out to become who she is today.

> [{quoted}](name=Rhlax,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=oFWE3HOk,comment-id=00030005,timestamp=2015-02-05T03:11:46.501+0000)
>
> What is driving her to be a master of the blade? Perhaps fencing was her escape. Perhaps her pain caused her to turn into fencing, eventually making her the grand duelist she is today. 
> 
> Fencing is certainly not a cheap hobby, perhaps she was well off. Perhaps her parents died young, leaving her and her little sister on the street. Fencing was her perhaps hope for survival, so she fenced day in and out to become who she is today.

This is the kind of thing I thinking about. Who is Fiora... how much deeper can she go? Going to respond to another comment with more.

Why does there have to be some past pain or secret history?  In her lore it's spelled out.  She is a Demacian noble who's been raised and groomed to fence, and like many nobles, is told they are the very best.  Her ego was stroked and she trained and dueled her way to the top until her father used her gaining more power.

She's cocky, snobbish and supremely arrogant.  At her core she probably isn't that bad of a person but her noble roots make her quite the snoot.

I think that's fine for a character.  I don't see why she needs to be pained and tragic.  She's just kind of a bitch.  That's fine. Let her be.  But she should be a bitch that has the skill to back up her talk.

> [{quoted}](name=Baron Von Bangin,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=oFWE3HOk,comment-id=0003000500000002,timestamp=2015-02-05T17:47:16.570+0000)
>
> Why does there have to be some past pain or secret history?  In her lore it's spelled out.  She is a Demacian noble who's been raised and groomed to fence, and like many nobles, is told they are the very best.  Her ego was stroked and she trained and dueled her way to the top until her father used her gaining more power.
> 
> She's cocky, snobbish and supremely arrogant.  At her core she probably isn't that bad of a person but her noble roots make her quite the snoot.
> 
> I think that's fine for a character.  I don't see why she needs to be pained and tragic.  She's just kind of a bitch.  That's fine. Let her be.  But she should be a bitch that has the skill to back up her talk.

This. We already have Lucian and Vayne when it comes to tragic Demacian figure - Fiora should represent the epitome of finesse and nobility. She is both defined by her skill as by her arrogance. All those who have doubted her inevitably met her blade, and she could always back up her words.  She is educated, snobbish, but also a fencing genius. She definitely has her place in Demacian politics; she has pride and poise. Even her fighting discipline alludes to the idea that she is a fighter within the royal court more than a soldier. 

If I were to draw a parallel with another League character, then I'd say Fiora is diametrically opposed to Leblanc. While the leader of the Black Rose is a schemer who betrays and acts from the shadows, Fiora faces her enemies head-on. No games, no tricks, just skill and honor. 

*That* is who Fiora is.

Personally, I see more of a dichotomy and tension between Talon{{champion:91}}  and Fiora {{champion:114}}. Talon uses some of the same underhanded tricks and dirty fighting as Leblanc, and probably has an axe to grind with this haughty Demacian noble who never had to go hungry at night. You said better than I could what Fiora is like, and I *know* she would have a problem with some "insolent peasant" from Noxus daring to challenge her.
She's a cocky (with good reason) woman who wants to be the best. Not saying she can't be more, but please don't dramatically change her. I don't want another Xerath or Trundle.
We need no other troll kings or jefars

eh, I really don't care about why she fences, or what trauma-drama she had in her life. I want to know what she has *done* what she can *do* what she *will do.*

I want her accomplishments, I want her drive, I want to know what she's willing to do and just how far she's willing to go to get what she wants. I want to know who she *IS* not who she was.
One's past gives clue to one's future.

eh, to some extent. but I don't want that to be the focus of who she is. I want the focus to be the now, the present. I really dislike it when stories focus on trauma/drama of some character's past and leave a weak present. I want a strong sense of whe she is *now* not how she got to where she is and every little rock she had to climb to get there.

In the words of Edna Mode, "I never look back, darling! It distracts from the now."
She felt dishonored by her father. Their family are known for their fencing. She's from a noble house. She wants to restore honor to her family's name and be the best.
so, batman?

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Sweet,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=oFWE3HOk,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-02-04T23:53:42.237+0000) 
> There are so many opportunities to mold her into something stronger, better. Curious what you guys think she could become.

Well, just from her in-game story, I'd say a big theme of hers is fighting fairly (but kicking butt), and restoring honor to her family's name. Maybe her story is more than her "defeating" her father... maybe that "defeat" wasn't as permanent as she'd like to believe, and wiping the floor with her father in their duel will come back to bite her as he seeks revenge against his daughter. And of course, since she would never resort to trickery and deceit to fight back, that would put her at a serious disadvantage against him.

I don't know what the full backstory would be for such a scenario though. Is there anything in particular YOU see special about her? I'm curious. :)

> [{quoted}](name=GhastlyGhoulMan,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=oFWE3HOk,comment-id=00030001,timestamp=2015-02-05T00:59:33.627+0000)

> 
> I don't know what the full backstory would be for such a scenario though. Is there anything in particular YOU see special about her? I'm curious. :)

I'd love to see more of her role in Demacia and how her honorable family's fall from grace impacted the rest of the culture. Her honor is personified through her blade and skill, how does this translate to her style in game? I could definitely see her strength in 1:1 increase and her weaknesses show in team fighting.  

Beyond that who is she besides a disciplined fighter? When she has reached the pinnacle of skill what would motivate her next. Fiora has an opportunity to be more than just a semi-tragic hero.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Sweet,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=oFWE3HOk,comment-id=000300010000,timestamp=2015-02-05T03:43:22.295+0000)

> I'd love to see more of her role in Demacia and how her honorable family's fall from grace impacted the rest of the culture. Her honor is personified through her blade and skill, how does this translate to her style in game? I could definitely see her strength in 1:1 increase and her weaknesses show in team fighting.  
> 
> Beyond that who is she besides a disciplined fighter? When she has reached the pinnacle of skill what would motivate her next. Fiora has an opportunity to be more than just a semi-tragic hero.

I feel Fiora could be like a mix of a Riven with a spice of Draven personality.
Someone that wants honor/redemption but in a flashy/witty/taunty way.

Fiora wants to show the world that honor is the greatest strength.
She may search to defeat famous thiefs/weapon masters/soldiers only for the show of it. LIKE JAX (wich is a rival atm but we dont know much)
You guys could make a Jax/Fiora story. Maybe something like Jax was her brother cough, or newcomer that did things with a gang in the same region but Jax wanted money/power and didn't care for honor and she tried to stop him, because he's power without honor, something she can't let live.


I'm gonna do a kit for her, I DON'T want her to be "that" but that may explains more what I'm saying.

Passive: En Garde! Fiora attacks on an enemy marks her target gaining 15-50 attack damage against it also making her abilities more powerful against that enemy (Only one enemy can be mark every 9 sec)

Q: Lunge and Point
Fiora will Lunge at her enemy (making her next attack gaining extra range), if the target is marked she will also Point making it a piercing hit that ignore some part of the armor the enemy is wearing

W: Parry and Riposte
Fiora will Parry next melee or ranged attack, if the target is marked she will also do a Riposte dealing damage and snaring her target for a short time (1sec)

E: Recovery and Redoublement
Fiora will remove all slow effects, if an enemy is marked in less than X she will also remove all snares effect and dash on it.

R: Blade Waltz and Touché
Fiora dance with her blade to the sounds of her enemies making her invulnerable shortly, applying a debuff to her enemies making them more vulnerable to the next damage but not dealing a lot of damage itself
 , if an enemy is marked she will concentrate her strikes on him to finish him (doing less overall damage but should be working like an execute). If she fails to kill she will lose the mark on that target.

There is no pinnacle of skill; to her, at least. Even when she's the strongest duelist in the land and can beat anyone in a fight, I don't think she'd be satisfied, and would still seek to improve herself.

> [{quoted}](name=Hellioning,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=oFWE3HOk,comment-id=0003000100000000,timestamp=2015-02-05T03:56:01.931+0000)
>
> There is no pinnacle of skill; to her, at least. Even when she's the strongest duelist in the land and can beat anyone in a fight, I don't think she'd be satisfied, and would still seek to improve herself.

That would be kind of ronin-like in a way, wouldn't it?  That's not necessarily a bad thing though, but it would make her somewhat similar to Yasuo while at the same time his complete opposite.  Even more so that they live on opposite sides of the continent with completely different fighting styles.  Yasuo says "My honor left me a long time ago," which probably means he'd resort to the lowest of lows if he had to.  Fiora on the other hand would never forsake her honor since she's trying to reclaim it.

Never reaching a pinnacle of skill is NOT the same thing as being a wandering ronin. Ronin are samurai who have been shamed, exiled, etc. They are failures to their people, their emperor, their honor. Yasuo left his honor long ago because he FAILED his one sacred duty, and as a result has killed those who he once called friends. He's fallen from grace in a completely different way than Fiora has.

> [{quoted}](name=Vanisher15,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=oFWE3HOk,comment-id=000300010000000000000000,timestamp=2015-02-05T04:24:47.626+0000)
>
> Never reaching a pinnacle of skill is NOT the same thing as being a wandering ronin. Ronin are samurai who have been shamed, exiled, etc. They are failures to their people, their emperor, their honor. Yasuo left his honor long ago because he FAILED his one sacred duty, and as a result has killed those who he once called friends. He's fallen from grace in a completely different way than Fiora has.

Ahh, but in her story, her family has fallen from grace.  That's her shame, especially since her father was the mechanism for which the disgrace originates.  
That's their similarity.  The rest is their differences.  It's really interesting when you look at it from that perspective.

But she seems so nonchalant in her VO that the backstory just doesn't match. You don't hear any of that dishonor or strive to restore her family's honor or her drive to become as skilled as her father. All you hear is a cocky duelist that says "ho ho~" everytime she parries.

And her ult voice isn't a furious sounding 'ha' -- it's a nonchalant sounding and overly French sounding 'ha'. The French part is okay, the lack of any real feeling of her trying at all isn't.

But the main point of this is that when you play Fiora you have absolutely no clue of what her backstory is. It doesn't reflect in gameplay. Not even a slight hint anywhere. You just know she is a cocky, French-accented duelist. That's it.

I was not debating the fact that they've both fallen and are shamed. I was merely wanting to point out that wanting to reach a high level of skill is not what a ronin is or does. Maybe i went too far into my explanation, sorry!

> [{quoted}](name=Vanisher15,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=oFWE3HOk,comment-id=00030001000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-02-05T06:36:10.800+0000)
>
> I was not debating the fact that they've both fallen and are shamed. I was merely wanting to point out that wanting to reach a high level of skill is not what a ronin is or does. Maybe i went too far into my explanation, sorry!

Oh no you're fine.  I was just continuing the conversation and pointing out their similarities and differences is all.  It makes for an interesting comparison.

I agree with the 1v1 strength fitting her personality. Although I guess once she mastered fencing, she could always move on to painting; that picture of Teemo she draws in the air needs some SERIOUS work. ;)


... More seriously though, I kind of agree with the line of thinking of Rhlax, where she could perhaps have an entirely different background than she does right now. I don't know one way or the other how much the Story Team wants to reset her story. I feel like she's got to have something to fight for or against though. Some enemy, or an ideal she finds "evil". Is there someone that wronged her? Perhaps she *was* left with her sibling on the streets (let's say little brother), and she and her brother grow up in a wicked underbelly hidden underneath the righteous glitter of Demacia, which she then grows up to despise (the "underbelly", not Demacia itself).

Something like that could make mastering the art of fencing a smaller part of a greater goal.

>What makes her more unique, what makes her stand out past this?

A devotion to fair play almost as vicious as her attacks. Fiora is a haughty self absorbed bitch born out of Demacia's culture of honor and justice.
Shes a great example of how Demancian are not necessarily good guys, and even if they are good does not mean nice.

Mechanically, a kit that doesn't weaken or sap its opponents so much as outmaneuver and overtaking them. Fiora does this currently, but she fails to be the constantly moving fencer that is her fantasy.

Fiora is the Grand Duelist, even if she can't out duel Jax

Fiora has a ton of great stuff already in there, she just needs a second chance at hitting the mark. Much like Quinn in my opinion.
What makes her unique is that she wants to be the very best for the sake of restoring lost honor. Not exactly a new tale, but one that fits her quite well, I think.

I personally think that Fiora is only odd to play because she is an Assassin hats supposed to be skilled duelist. What makes her more of an assassin than a powerful duelist is that her dueling potential is almost entirely reliant on her (R)-Blade Waltz. If you are a Fiora and have it up you can 1v1 anyone, however if you do not you're pretty much dead in most situations. Fiora is supposed to be the grand duelist and yet she isn't so grand without blade waltz.

Yes her W-Riposte can give her great dueling potential in addition with her attack speed steroid E-Burst of Speed. However these two skills alone do not make her a powerful duelist at all, but rather compliment the fact she can dish out sustained damage. These skills do not allow her to do what duelists do best which is outplay in any 1v1 scenario. Riposte can have the potential to outplay, but at the same time not really.

Compare this ability to another great duelist and split pusher Jax.  Jax is a great duelist and as good if not better than fiora in this respect due to his skill E-Counter Strike. Unlike Riposte is pretty much nullify's EVERYTHING being thrown at Jax AND stuns the enemies! Fiora's Riposte only blocks a single auto attack or empowered strike (Like a Nasus Q for example); and while that is useful in key moment sin a duel where certain spells can turn a tide... it's not reliable at all.

All fiora gets from W thats reliable is more guaranteed damage from a passive effect. Jax imo is the Fiora that can be in team fights even without his ultimate and by definition IS the GRAND DUELIST. His passive does what fiora's E does, his E is a better version of her W and his W in both passive and active form make his dueling potential ridiculous. What Fiora needs is to be less akin to an all in assassin and more akin to a duelist like Jax.

To do this she needs to be able to respond to many attacks at many intervals, given resets and given the tools to out play anyone in a 1v1 or even a 2v1 scenario at the expense of her assassin like qualities, that being invulnerability from blade waltz. Something like resets and significantly reduced cooldowns on parry's, luges and such.

I main Fiora myself and like the way how she plays the most. I am actually scared that if you change her to much or some core components this might change. So in my opinions i would not change the core components which make her what she is. However you can add things on top of her. 

Fiora core components are in my opinion:
(Champion wise) That she is not girlish but rather a strong, determined, smart and sharp young woman who knows what to and when to do it. She thinks things through and after she takes a decision there is no going back. She is pretty but she puts more focus into athletics than makeup.
(In Battle) If you decide to go in with her in the right moment there is no getting out anymore(you used Q two times). Then you in the heat of the duel and if you press the right buttons in the right time, riposte just about when they are about to empower their hit and burst of speed when their CC is on cooldown, then you are supposed to win every duel by a lot. Fiora is second strongest melee DPS (after Trynda) after all.
(In Battle) she has no CC and escapes but really high DPS.


Fiora bonus components or things which can be added in my opinion are:
(Champion wise) She gets a background and a reason why she is this strong of a dueler. Second strongest DPS when compared with other champions which are mostly gods, just feels a little unfitting. I think you need to add something there as to where she breaks out of a random fencer and becomes something more.. What more i don't know myself, it could be actually something mysterious where no one knows what. But she has to be lore wise someone can can kill gods with raw power and precise skill.
(In Battle) Her ulti in a team fights is a little boring in the sense that you just press R and you have to pray to the RNG gods that something good happens even if you are a skilled player. On the other side she will make it a Penta even if you are really unskilled only by being feed. Thats something which has to change on her. Her Ulti should keep her a dueler but with her ulti you are not dueling only one enemy but rather two-three enemy's. She gets mobility to jump from one to another (dodging some skills when doing right), and something in that direction. She gets empowered like Riven does. That would bring them a little closer. The Riven Fiora matchup is one of the best matchups in the game in my opinion. So them being rivals and having something in common is not a bad thing. 
(...) Riven was always Cloud for me and Fiora Sephiroph (When she ultis she can fly from one enemy to another ;))

So I'm not saying that Jax needs a rework, or that Fiora needs to be the polar opposite of him, but seeing as how they're both martial artists known for their skill, and they're rivals, maybe there should be some similarities and contrasts between them?

Why is she French, by the way? I was thinking about this the other day. Fiora is Demacian, but she had a French accent, while Garen is from the same city-state, but doesn't have the same accent. The same goes for Braum and the other champions from the Freljord and maybe some others that I'm missing
Idgaf what she becomes as long as get rid if her untargetability. Its not healthy for the game.

Her passive is really good, actually. The lane sustain is welcome, but I don't know how fitting it is for a *duelist* to have this kind of passive. Especially since she's so squishy. In an actual 1v1 fight its not really going to do much unless you either kill them quickly or trade and run away.


Make her Q a skillshot dash like renektons. 

Do something with riposte, I don't know what. I really like riposte as it is, Many a time have I outplayed someone using it, but something just feels wrong about it. Maybe if she deflects an attack instead of doing damage it shreds their armor, opening them up for a burst?

E- No idea what to do with this. This is as good a steroid as any. 

R- This thing just needs to be either completely changed, or be more reliable. If I ult Leblanc I'm basically just killing myself, because of her stealth negating most of the damage. I'd honestly like to see it be something like Legion commander from DoTA. Forcibly dueling someone for a while. Perhaps removing both of you from play for a while, making you both un-targettable by either team then fighting it out?

I don't think sword art online should be her inspiration. Anyways as stated multiple times she has a no brainer kit for a champ whose theme is dueling and outplaying someone. There's nothing mechanical about a fiora play which is why she needs a rework.

Sword Art Online doesn't have to be the inspiration for her playstyle. I just chose GIFs from it because they're flashy and do a good job of showing off what Fiora should be doing (parrying your attacks and then cutting you to pieces with her sword). 

I wouldn't mind a more mechanically complex, high skill cap Fiora either. One skill idea I was tossing around in my head for a while was making Riposte a very short duration spellshield (like, less then 1 second), but reducing the cooldown to 2 seconds on a successful block, so that you were rewarded for fast reflexes while still leaving some counterplay to her opponents (bait out her spellshield or use your CC in her vulnerable window).

> I just chose GIFs from it because they're flashy and do a good job of showing off what Fiora should be doing (parrying your attacks and then cutting you to pieces with her sword).

Really? Looks a lot more like flailing wildly. Those gifs look more like sword spaghetti tossed on a wall than skillful fencers dueling.

Edit: Btw, I enjoyed SAO. I know it's cool to hate on popular shows, but I found it fun. As inspiration for Fiora, though, not so much.
sao has rapiers too ya know. inspiration from an anime world does not have to be limited to the main protagonist.

I used to main Fiora top (fuck me right)  for about the first 6 months of last season. Played her because she was fun, but i hated the feeling of "we can't team fight till  my ult is off cd," because you are softer than Irelia's ass in her frostblade skin. 

I found it very strange back then that so many people thought fiora was either terrible or OP. As someone who played her i knew her weaknesses, but they certainly didn't make her terrible. I knew her strengths, but at the time (stupidly) i didn't think she was OP. It was just that the tank meta was what dominated top lane, and we all know what you build to beat Fiora. Mundo/Shyv and Ren didn't exactly have to go off their build path for that. 

I'd like for them to change her E and ult. I love the ult, but i hate untagetability. I wish i was creative enough to give suggestions on how she should be changed, but hey i don't get paid for that.
+1 for mentioning frostbutt Irelia. Good job sir

I want Riot to make Fiora into the best goddamn duelist in the game. 

If that's a nerf then I don't know how any changes could please you.

When the Fiora is bad

http://img2.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20120728211611/meme/es/images/1/14/Star_Wars_Kid.gif

Fiona should be a mechanically demanding, engaging melee carry with strong dueling potential and the ability to quickly maneuver around the battlefield and outsmart opponents with constant dazzling combos and lightning speed. In service to this core engagement potential, I'm going to suggest something that's going to cause people to pop rage boners at the mere thought of it:

Make her manaless like Riven and Yasuo. They're already more or less doing what Fiona wants to be doing, in their own ways. So lets have Fiona take some notes and let her be the fancy swordswoman we want her to be, as opposed to being like every autoattack-centric champion: Boring until they ult, then still boring but killing people.
I dont like this idea at all.
Btw nice sword art online :P do you want a asuna skin for Fiora?
I don't necessarily WANT one, but I'd buy it if Riot made it ;)

As a Mid Fiora main (And Jungler). High ELO. 
I disagree with your current pictures. 

Your TL;DR says she should "primarily be a duelist and not ulting in teamfights." 
I agree. 
That is exactly what Riot did in their latest patch on Fiora. They gave her ult less Multi-Target Damage and more Single-Target Damage. In my opinion as a Mid/Top/Jungle player, there are very FEW champions that counter Fiora in lane. She is such a strong duelist and 1v1 champ, that it always requires the enemy jungler to shut me down.

The major problem I see with Fiora is the stigma against her. Out of 50 games, I probably get about 2-3 ganks.
As a Fiora player, you must always prove yourself to your teammates first. This can be difficult, but not impossible.
Good Luck Fiora enthusiast.
I'm curious how you feel about fiora vs renek/jax/irelia/riven.

They used to be matchups that took a lot of skill and specific rune pages.
But now, Fiora is dead. RIP

I really hope Riot comes through with the Fiora rework. I absolutely love Fiora. I love her Blade Waltz as it curently is, but I think her character as a whole could use some brushing up. 

Even though there are times when I time Blade Waltz to finish off one opponent and bounce to another enemy to finish them off as well, Blade Waltz is the only ability in her kit that makes me feel like I played her really well when I pull it off. 

I just wish the rest of her kit could be made so that she feels like a champion with an extremely high skill cap, kind of like Yasuo and Riven. I'd love to duel those champions as the reworked Fiora with a higher skillcap.
